content: Support Grows for Maine Marriage Bill March 13, 2009 More than 60 legislators in Maine have co-sponsored a new same-sex marriage bill in the state, headed up by Democratic Senator Dennis Damon of Trenton. According to the Associated Press, support for the measure has come in large numbers from both parties, causing the leadership to make sponsorship of the bill unlimited. The measure is expected to pass through the committee stage with little trouble, but it’s future beyond that point remains uncertain. If the bill does get passed into law, Maine will join Connecticut and Massachusetts as the only states in the U.S. to allow gay marriage. The Advocate

title: Support Grows for Maine Marriage Bill

content: Ultimately, expect this issue to be yet another to eventually be taken up by the Supreme Court and decided based upon the composition of the court.

title: Support Grows for Maine Marriage Bill
